TITLE: Reporter’s Notebook: Chad Pergram remembers Jan. 6 attack one year later
SUMMARY: I remember when I walk through the Capitol Rotunda.

TITLE: Americans say 2021 'sucked,' but are optimistic about 2022: Poll
SUMMARY: Nearly half of all American voters are “hopeful” about 2022 after using words like “awful, terrible, bad,” and “sucked” to describe 2021, according to a new national poll.

TITLE: Political cartoon of the day: Same issues, different year
Biden walks on eggshells as approval sinks, far-left loses confidence, and GOP 'ready to pounce'
SUMMARY: As President Biden and the Democratic party enter a tight midterm election year, some progressives within his own party are considering challenging him in 2024.

TITLE: Biden and Harris to visit Capitol, mark anniversary of Jan 6 riot
SUMMARY: President Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris will visit the U.S. Capitol Thursday to mark the anniversary of last year's January 6 riot.

TITLE: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez filmed maskless at packed Florida bar
SUMMARY: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-N.Y., was recorded without a mask in a densely packed bar in Miami, according to footage that emerged Sunday.

TITLE: Fauci, Walensky comments raise new concerns on whether science or 'pushback' are guiding COVID policies
SUMMARY: New COVID-19 guidance from Dr. Anthony Fauci and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Director Dr. Rochelle Walensky have caused some to question whether public health officials are making decisions based on science or prevailing opinion.

TITLE: New Jersey's first lady tests positive for COVID-19 after travel to Costa Rica
SUMMARY: New Jersey first lady Tammy Murphy tested positive for COVID-19 after the family's controversial trip to Costa Rica over the Christmas holiday.

TITLE: Fauci teases new testing recommendation despite shortages
SUMMARY: Dr. Anthony Fauci said Sunday the CDC might adopt a new testing recommendation for Americans looking to leave isolation after five days – a measure which would come while COVID-19 test shortages are already plaguing the nation as the omicron variant of the coronavirus surges.

TITLE: NY Gov. Hochul declares racism a ‘public health crisis’
SUMMARY: Democratic New York Gov. Kathy Hochul signed legislation that went into effect Saturday that declares racism a "public health crisis" and establishes a "racial equity working group" in the state.

TITLE: Fauci, teachers unions at odds over reopening schools
SUMMARY: Dr. Anthony Fauci on Sunday expressed support for reopening schools after the holiday break, offering guidance that contradicts the ongoing push from teachers unions to keep schools shuttered.

TITLE: The six biggest campaign questions of 2022
SUMMARY: From the battle for Congress to the early Trump and Biden 2024 moves, here are six major political questions that will hover over 2022.

TITLE: Pramila Jayapal says Twitter’s ban on Marjorie Taylor Greene ‘too little,’ ‘too late’
SUMMARY: Rep. Pramila Jayapal, D-Wash., said on MSNBC’s "The Sunday Show" that Twitter’s permanent ban on the personal account of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., is "too little" and "too late."

TITLE: Marjorie Taylor Greene's personal Twitter account permanently suspended over COVID-19 ‘misinformation’
SUMMARY: Twitter announced Sunday that it had permanently suspended the personal account of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, R-Ga., over alleged COVID-19 "misinformation."

TITLE: Marjorie Taylor Greene permanently banned from Twitter
SUMMARY: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene’s personal Twitter account was permanently banned for violating the tech giant’s “COVID-19 misinformation policy.”

TITLE: Ed Sec Cardona says students need in-person classes despite omicron: 'They’ve suffered enough'
SUMMARY: Secretary of Education Miguel Cardona stressed the need to keep schools open for in-person learning despite a surge in coronavirus cases brought on in significant part by the omicron variant.

TITLE: Ayanna Pressley joins long list of Dem lawmakers testing positive for coronavirus
SUMMARY: Rep. Ayanna Pressley announces she tested positive for the coronavirus.

TITLE: Biden nominee equated 'proof of citizenship' with 'voter suppression,' likened felon voting ban to slavery
SUMMARY: Nancy Gbana Abudu, President Biden's nominee for the 11th Circuit Court of Appeals, has a history of suggesting that voting regulations -- like the ban on convicted felons voting -- are racist.

TITLE: Rubio says 'real crisis' surrounding coronavirus spike is 'irrational hysteria'
SUMMARY: Sen. Marco Rubio ripped the “irrational hysteria" surrounding the surge of coronavirus cases.

TITLE: Dallas Morning News ripped for 'utterly classless story' on Ted Cruz's teenage daughter
SUMMARY: Critics slammed the Dallas Morning News on social media after publishing a story on Sen. Ted Cruz's 13-year-old daughter's TikTok video.

TITLE: Schumer to use Jan. 6 anniversary to make push for federal voting rights bill
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer is using the one year anniversary of the Jan. 6 attack on Capitol Hill to stress the importance of passing, what he described as, "urgently-needed" voting rights legislation.

TITLE: Two GOP senators have yet to say if they're running for reelection in November
SUMMARY: With 10 months to go until the 2022 midterms, two senators - both Republicans - remain mum on whether they’ll seek another term on Capitol Hill

TITLE: Ron DeSantis pressures Biden admin to let states purchase monoclonal antibody treatments
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is calling on the Biden administration to allow his state to obtain monoclonal antibody treatments for residents.

TITLE: COVID-19: Congress' doctor desires 'maximal telework posture'
SUMMARY: Congress' top doctor urged lawmakers on Monday to move to a “maximal telework posture," citing surging numbers of COVID-19 cases at the Capitol – mostly among people already vaccinated.

TITLE: Eric Adams considers COVID booster mandate for NYC workers
SUMMARY: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he is considering implementing a COVID booster mandate for city workers.

TITLE: House Republicans say Capitol is no safer a year after Jan. 6 attacks, slam Democrats for 'partisan' probe
SUMMARY: House Republicans warned that the Capitol is no more secure a year after the deadly Jan. 6 attack, slamming House Democrats for failing to implement proposed security reforms and instead focusing on their "partisan" investigation into the origin of the incident.

TITLE: Donald Trump Jr., Ivanka Trump subpoenaed by NY attorney general in Trump Organization probe
SUMMARY: New York Attorney General Letitia James recently issued subpoenas for former President Trump and his two eldest children in connection with a civil investigation into the family’s business practices.

TITLE: Despite democracy fears, more Americans accept Biden's election than they did Trump's four years ago
SUMMARY: Despite loud concerns about the state of democracy, more Americans believe that President Biden's win in the 2020 election is legitimate than believed the same about former President Donald Trump's 2016 victory

TITLE: Bill Gardner, longest serving secretary of state in the nation, announces his retirement
SUMMARY: After nearly a half a century in office, New Hampshire Secretary of State Bill Gardner, the longest serving secretary of state in the nation, is stepping down.

TITLE: DeSantis urges hospitals to distinguish those hospitalized due to COVID and those who just happen to have it
SUMMARY: FT. LAUDERDALE — Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis pointed to efforts of one of his state's largest hospital systems as an example of practical data tracking that can give a clearer picture of the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: DeSantis jokes about Dems from strict COVID states visiting Florida after AOC spotted maskless in Miami
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis joked about how Democrats from states with “draconian” pandemic policies keep popping up in his state for vacation.

TITLE: Manhattan DA closes probe into nursing home deaths without charging Cuomo: attorney
SUMMARY: The Manhattan district attorney's office is closing its investigation into former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo's handling of nursing home COVID-19 deaths without bringing charges against Cuomo, according to the former governor's attorney.

TITLE: Judge issues stay against vaccine mandate for Navy SEALs seeking religious exemption
SUMMARY: A federal judge granted a temporary injunction Monday against a federal vaccine mandate for Navy SEALs who sued President Biden because they were seeking a religious exemption.

TITLE: Teachers unions across country cite COVID surge to demand halt to in-person learning
SUMMARY: A surge in COVID-19 cases has prompted some teachers unions to call for a return to remote learning.

TITLE: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick positive for COVID, has been vaccinated and boosted
SUMMARY: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick is on the mend after testing positive for COVID-19 despite being vaccinated and receiving a booster shot.

TITLE: Top Republican charges Pelosi is restricting access to Jan. 6 records in GOP probe of her actions
SUMMARY: House Administration Committee ranking member Rep. Rodney Davis, R-Ill., penned a letter to House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., demanding House offices under her control stop obstructing a GOP investigation into the Capitol building's security vulnerabilities.

TITLE: Democratic Rep. Bobby Rush set to retire after 15 terms in Congress
SUMMARY: Rep. Bobby Rush, D-Ill., announced Monday that he is retiring from Congress after having served 15 terms since he was first elected in 1992.

TITLE: Ted Cruz floats Biden impeachment if GOP takes back House
SUMMARY: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, said in an interview Monday that it is likely that Republicans will win back the House in 2022, and said if they do, they will probably consider impeaching President Biden.

TITLE: Biden once called Trump’s COVID-19 testing push a ‘travesty,’ faces own criticism
SUMMARY: President Biden’s tough criticism of his predecessor’s effort to make COVID-19 tests available has resurfaced while his own administration faces blowback over test shortages.

TITLE: Stefanik, in first Senate endorsement of 2022 midterms, throws support behind Ohio GOP candidate Jane Timken
SUMMARY: FIRST ON FOX: House Republican Conference Chair Elise Stefanik on Tuesday announced her first E-PAC Senate candidate endorsement – throwing her support behind GOP candidate Jane Timken in Ohio.

TITLE: Biden admin roiled by crises on Afghanistan, border, inflation, COVID – but heads yet to roll
SUMMARY: President Biden has signaled he's sticking with his team, despite a series of missteps during his first year in office that have tanked his approval ratings.

TITLE: Meet the Democrats who could replace Pelosi as party leader in 2023
SUMMARY: With House Speaker Nancy Pelsoi expected to step aside after 2022 – especially if Democrats lose the House – speculation is already emerging about who might be her replacement as the chamber's top Democrat.

TITLE: Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine among stranded in I-95 winter storm disaster, says he’s been stuck 19 hours
SUMMARY: Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine revealed Tuesday that he has been stuck 19 hours and counting in the Interstate-95 traffic disaster that has stranded hundreds of travelers outside of the nation’s capital.

TITLE: 9 Biden secretaries flunk in watchdog calendar transparency report
SUMMARY: Protect the Public Trust, a federal government watchdog organization, released their report on Tuesday, which paints an opaque picture of the Biden administration’s Cabinet.

TITLE: Schumer targets filibuster reform to pass voting rights legislation
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., kicked off the new year with another effort to blow up the Senate filibuster to pass federal voting reform legislation.

TITLE: Trump-backed Senate challenger Tshibaka charges Alaska’s Murkowski is ‘queen of qualms’
SUMMARY: The Trump backed Republican Senate candidate primary challenging GOP Sen. Lisa Murkowski of Alaska argues that the longtime senator during her tenure has voted to confirm “radical leftists”

TITLE: Biden administration to double purchase of Pfizer's COVID antiviral pill to 20M treatment courses
SUMMARY: EXCLUSIVE: President Biden on Tuesday is expected to direct health officials to double the U.S. government's purchase of Pfizer's antiviral COVID pill from 10 million to 20 million treatment courses and will accelerate the delivery of those treatments, a senior administration official told Fox News.

TITLE: Michigan redistricting map, praised by Obama, faces lawsuit alleging Black disenfranchisement
SUMMARY: A Michigan redistricting map that was praised by former President Obama is facing a lawsuit from current and former lawmakers who allege that it disenfranchises Black voters.

TITLE: Marsha Blackburn derides University of Memphis program incentivizing 'woke' course transformations
SUMMARY: Sen. Marsha Blackburn says the University of Memphis shouldn't be using taxpayer money to fund a "woke" agenda -- responding to reporting that the school was offering incentives for faculty to overhaul their courses.

TITLE: Biden's 'pandemic of the unvaccinated' narrative falls apart as omicron cases skyrocket
SUMMARY: President Biden has repeatedly claimed that vaccinated people cannot spread the virus, despite his own Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's warnings about breakthrough cases.

TITLE: Manchin rejects Build Back Better revival: 'There's been no conversations'
SUMMARY: Asked whether negotiations or conversations about compromise have been ongoing, Manchin denied any knowledge of BBB discussions after his statement last month against the policy package.

TITLE: Cuomo won't be prosecuted for sexual misconduct allegations, Albany DA announces
SUMMARY: The Albany County district attorney said he is set to drop a sexual misconduct charge against disgraced former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo.

TITLE: New York's racialized coronavirus priorities are illegal and warrant DOJ investigation, critics say
SUMMARY: Conservative legal analysts argue that New York is violating the Constitution and should be investigated after it said health care providers should consider race as a factor in COVID-19 treatments.

TITLE: Texas Gov. Abbott to sue federal government over vaccine mandate for National Guard
SUMMARY: Gov. Greg Abbott on Tuesday released a letter announcing his intention to sue the federal government for what he claimed is an unconstitutional vaccine mandate for the Texas National Guard.

TITLE: Texas Gov. Abbott to sue Biden admin over vaccine mandate for National Guard
SUMMARY: Gov. Greg Abbott on Tuesday released a letter announcing his intention to sue the federal government for what he claimed is an unconstitutional vaccine mandate for the Texas National Guard.
